markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 9"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Ixamè's Eye](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1446)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Talisman" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=155" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #171: Hurricane's Howl](/Sources.aspx?ID=101) pg. 76</row>

**Price** 150 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** affixed to headgear

</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Free Action" /><row>envision</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Via some strange alchemical reaction with the gasses of Terwa Lake, the [cloud dragon](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=176) Ixamè's eyeballs have shriveled into sky-blue gems. The dragon's sense of vision isn't impaired, and her eyes can't be removed from her head until she's destroyed. Once removed, each gem functions as a special talisman. _Ixamè's eye_ sparkles when it's in an area of fog or mist. Activating the talisman enables you to see clearly through fog and mist for 1 minute; any creature [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) only by fog or mist is no longer concealed to you. If such a creature was relying on the concealment to [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62) or [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63), this also means it's no longer [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Ixamè's Eye

The dragon's sense of vision isn't impaired, and her eyes can't be removed from her head until she's destroyed. Once removed, each gem functions as a special talisman. Ixamè's eye sparkles when it's in an area of fog or mist. If such a creature was relying on the concealment to Hide or Sneak, this also means it's no longer hidden or undetected.
